text:
Nothing special about this place, and the service is terrible. We had the pancakes and an omelette, and the food was nothing above average, and quite expensive. 

We waited forever for a refill on water and coffee, and finally had to ask another server. It was a Sunday morning, and they had QVC playing on the tvs. Wtf? 

I wouldn't waste my money here, and would instead go somewhere better for the money.
food was good...service is kind of slow... my wife had a steak and it wasn't as good as she expected. I however enjoy the saut√©ed broccoli. may attend again but it wouldn't be my first choice

Coming from New York, I'm a huge fan of the Scotto family restaurants.  I was delighted to see a sign proclaiming that this establishment was owned by the Scotto family.

This place is an aberration.  The food is just OK, and the waiter neglected to bring out my coke even after asking for it twice.  The signs on the outside of the restaurant had embarrassingly obvious grammatical errors on it.  In general, the lack of attention to detail manifested itself throughout the entire meal.  This place was just underwhelming and not up to the usual Scotto standards.

After being told, at another oyster bar, that there would be a two hour wait, my husband and I decided to give Oyster Bay Seafood a try.  We definitely were not disappointed,  

We sat at the bar, and the bartender Cody could not have been more attentive.  Fantastic service!  The oysters were amazing and the drinks were great.  

I highly recommend Oyster Bay Seafood and will be back on my next trip to Vegas.

These are all old reviews. I ate there yesterday on a whim.  My boyfriend and I had just gotten lunch at the Earl of Sandwich, when we were walking and saw Oyster Bay. We both LOVE oysters, and for $12 for half a dozen, that is the cheapest you are going to find by far. We are used to paying $20+ for a half dozen at most places out in LV for decent oysters. We sat at the oyster bar and talked to one of the chef's and the bartender for at least an hour over a couple of beers, shots and many oysters. They were super friendly and the oysters were super good! I will recommend this place to anyone, don't get scared off by the reviews. Now, we didn't sit in the dining room and didn't order any other food besides the oysters, so I don't know how that experience will be, but we will definitely come to this place for lunch or dinner for the full experience the next time we are in town.
First time here & was highly recommended a good breakfast. So far service is excellent  and sure is the Breakfast is DELISH.

Great access to Oyster Bay from the Elara hotel, as it is in the Miracle Mile. 5 stars for the Shrimp linguini. Hands down the best pasta dish ever. However, my husband had the rock fish and he said it was pretty bad. Also our server was a bit slow when the restaurant was barely crowded. That is why I took off a star. But definitely get the Shrimp linguini. You won't be disappointed!

They advertise a special for breakfast lunch and dinner  but in the fine print it says with a drink purchase that's about $4. No other restaurant in the same building does that even the place right across the walkway does that. Plus the steak and was all burned
I had the best garden salad with grilled chicken at this place in the Planet Hollywood mall. The service was excellent. I will definitely return for a dinner meal.
Don't waste your money.... Soup was too salty, caprese salad had no taste & not even the bread was good.

Just went to eat at the Oyster Bay with my spouse. We were  looking for good honest italian cuisine, no fuss, no bs, just good fresh seafood and "Al dente" pasta.  We were not disappointed, in fact, overwhelmed!

We ordered fried calamari and Mediterranean Linguini.  Must say, the calamari were the best, freshest, I ever had.  The linguini's served with shrimps, mussels, clams, calamari basting in a freshly made pomodori sauce spiced to our liking.  Service by Monica was attentive and efficient.  

Overall, a great choice in a city were finding a good balance between quality and price is not an easy bet.

For the 2 of us, total bill with two glasses of wine: 99$ plus tip.

Well worth the small detour from the glitzy strip!

Just had the most wonderful dinner on the strip in Las Vegas. The Oyster Bay bar special was fantastic. Everything was so fresh and such a large portion crab cakes, cocktail shrimps, and calamari. All of this for  $22. Hard to beat this price on the strip.
Went to breakfast and had the eggs Benedict it was great. Server was chatty and  nice. Cute place

This place wasn't all that bad.  

The place seemed casual, but I think the restaurant was going for a little more dressy.  It's right next to the fake rainstorm display so you can hear it when you're seated outside the restaurant, like we were. I liked it, but if you don't care for the noise, then I'd suggest just taking a seat inside.  

We didn't have any of the seafood/clam/oyster stuff so I can't really review on what they signature.  But we ordered some steak and pastas which were pretty good.  Their angel hair was a little over-cooked for my taste, I like al dente pasta.  The grilled chicken on my pasta was good though, I liked the aroma that came with every bite.  The beef was odd, I think they might've over cooked it a little , it was too chewy on the outside.

The pricing for the oysters were really cheap though, but we weren't feeling oysters that night.  I'll probably go back for oysters next time. :)

1. We had to wait a very long time to order beverages. 
2. Once our order was taken, which took a about 15 minutes to see our server, we waited additional 10 for bread service. 
3. The server was short and borderline rude.
4. Or meal took nearly 25 minutes to be delivered. Mind you, the restaurant was empty. 
5. The chicken Marsalis was not enjoyable. The chicken breast was overcooked and very tough. I literally used a steak knife and it was still a struggle. The potatoes were from a box. 

Of all the fabulous restaurants in Las Vegas, I am sad I waisted so much money in this place.

Disappointing Bruschetta. Cheap bread with uncreative topping. Tasted ok but the quality just wasn't there. However the poached salmon was very good. The steak and eggs were good with the steak cooked exactly as ordered(rare). Not easy to do on a half inch thick steak. Service was very good. Our server was helpful without being annoying.

Our 4th time eating here ! Horrible food...Horrible service...
Will not return and the manager Dalvina was extremely rude  !
Stay away...you will get sick ! 
I got food poisoning after having Oysters ! 
Jenn

Horrible.....that's the only descriptor I can use.  The fish sandwich, allegedly cod, turned out to be fishsticks on dry bread.  When we asked for tartar sauce we were given Thousand Island dressing - yep, verified with the waiter that it was tartar sauce that he brought - NOT !  A complete waste of time & money - do yourself a favor & don't waste either !

This is actually one of my favorite places in Vegas for happy hour and oysters... I will say that I've never had a meal here, but my husband and I have had appetizers at the bar at least 5 times now over the past few years.  The bartender is always super-friendly and attentive and the oysters and soups have always been wonderful.  Even the chef shucking the oysters has been really nice to us.  In my opinion, it's at least worth a try for a late-afternoon snack and drinks. The happy hour specials ($10.95 for 6 oysters and 2-for-1 drinks) make it worth trying...

By far the best oysters that I ever had.... The 4 stars is because they screw up my wife's drink. They were kind enough to replace it but they make it wrong again. Never the less if you are looking for very VERY good oysters that's is your place!

This makes me sad to write this review as I had frequently enjoyed their clams with white wine sauce before.  I ordered them again and the clams were didn't taste fresh, very gritty and seemed to be in a watery fishy broth with no seasoning.  The normal crisp bread it comes with was actually just thick untoasted bread this time.  I also had the greek salad and a glass of shiraz which along with the bread and olive oil was the best part of the meal.  The waiter was also good. I also tried the beef stroganoff that was a special and it was awful as well.  It tasted like the noodles and meat were just covered with a can of cream of mushroom soup.  Unfortunately a good glass of wine and salad isn't enough to make me return ever again.  My dining companions were not satisfied with their meals either.

$7.95 for steak and eggs!

This place is delicious and convenient if you are staying at Planet Hollywood.

The prices are amazing for the quantity and quality you are receiving. 

Wished we had found this little gem earlier on, as it would have saved us from wasting money on subpar food elsewhere.

Friendly staff and quick service.

I'm spelling it wrong. But you get the idea. They were done PERFECTLY. Soft, succulent, flavorful and just an explosion of goodness in your mouth. For a seafood guy. It don't get much better. Oh and the crab cakes were just what you need to start things off. I always scrutinize my crab cakes yeah, for actual crab. But there is a tactile feel of the quantity and texture of REAL crabmeat that can't by faked or fooled with by filler. These cakes get it right! You may sit outside or in. I like to people watch. Believe me, it is like having a seat at a show of humanity, as the unending flow of folks from ALL walks of life file by you dressed in the most amazing attire and composed in different states of sobriety. I'll leave it at that....lol. Everyone having fun and doing their own thing. VEGAS BABY! Service was was good and the property had an upscale feel to it. A little pricey, but hey, you SHOULD get what you pay for and I'm worth it. Dessert menu was not impressive to me and I did not order any of the offerings. Loved the fish tank behind the bar with these 3 huge south american fish. No restroom. You have to walk about 50 yards and use the mall's bathroom. I guess cause space is a a premium. Nice culinary experience. Go. Enjoy.
very good food. good service. the part we didn't like is being reminded to include the tip when paying the bill.

This place is awful. The food was terrible and extremely overpriced. The wine list was insulting. The waitress was pleasant, but I felt there was a lot of pressure to oversell the quality of the food.  The only thing I liked about it was the decor. If you are looking for seafood, you may find the Filet O' Fish to be a better choice than Oyster Bay. If you are looking for a nice wine list, try Denny's instead. I agree with another reviewer....there are so many better options in Las Vegas, especially for this price range. Stay far, far away from Oyster Bay.
Prompt and pleasant service, our Anniversary Lunch well spent! Fresh seafood..  fantastic., I trust you'll enjoy.

decent food, below avg service, and avg. prices.
went for breakfast, so we didn't have any of the seafood. My reviews is solely on the breakfast food.

ordered the steak and eggs. was okay, the potatoes were really good tho. also came with some wheat bread. Pretty big portions, didn't finish everything. 

biggest negative was how long our food took to come out, damn near 25-30 minutes. that's way to damn long. table of 6.

Terrible service. Nice enough waiter but extremely inconsiderate coordination between kitchen and front line staff. We had a show at Axis at 9 and ordered the grilled Atlantic salmon (+roulade) at 7:50pm for which we were told there would be a 15 min wait because it had to sit in the oven. We informed them that was fine and that we had reservations at 9p. Well guess what? 45 mins later, they say they were having trouble with the oven and in the interim failed to at least bring us our other dish as well. We ended up getting our fried shrimp (which we ended up having to share) with 7 minutes to eat it in. It's terrible that given that busy location and clientele that they would have such terrible customer service and etiquette and failed to have informed us earlier. Will never reserve again at this establishment. I wonder how the salmon roulade tastes...

Don't go here!  It's extremely bad quality food and very over-priced.  Also our waitress was not very good and kind of old and senile.  Overall a terrible dining experience, I will not be coming back.

Made open table reservations, seated right away a couple hours before attending nearby Saxe Theater 7pm show, great wine selection, Our order was timely, we thoroughly enjoyed appetizer & meal.  Hostess & Wait staff very nice & attentive.  Definitely would return.

Gordon Ramsey, please help these people!!
This place gets 1 star for the atmosphere & their wonderful hostess.  Food tastes like it was previously frozen.  Lobster bisque was luke warm, salty & with no lobster.  Onion rings were chewy.  Chicken that was served on the ceasar salad looked & tasted like it was previously cooked.  Our server, Angel, was absent our whole meal... We were close to walking out mid meal.  I have not ate fast food for over 7 years, but I would eat McDonalds over this place.

We were walking around the mall looking for a place to grab lunch and settled on this spot. It didn't really seem like anything special, but the staff was friendly and the menu looked decent.

I wasn't really feeling pasta or anything, so I went with fish and chips. When it came out, I was a little disappointed. The fish looked like fish sticks, were very small, and there was only three of them.

The quality of the fish was a pleasant surprise though. It was very solid and meaty. 

Overall, I was happy with our choice of lunch here.

This place is located in the Planet Hollywood. If your looking for great Italian food, this is not it.  Food is just so so, and expensive.  Over priced and just paying for ambiance.  If your into ambiance,  then go for it.  Wife ordered Pasta with Mussels, and the mussels were small and not fresh.   My pasta with meat sauce was nothing special.  I have better pasta dishes at Pizza places.  On a positive note, the service was excellent. Good service and bad food is nothing to bring me back.  My suggestion is to go to other Italian resturant.

Totally unexpected!!! Just happened to pass it by while shopping in the miracle mile. I had the stuffed salmon and my wife had the chicken marsala. Both dishes were amazing. Our waiter John was great and Filipo the manager picked a perfect italian wine togo with our dinner. This resturant is Las Vegas's best kept secret.

As we walked in the staff were very welcoming. However, out waiter was extremely rude and condescending. He seemed to help everyone else around us but our table. 

The food was ok. My friend ordered the lobster bisque and there was no trace of lobster. It tasted like creamy tomato basil. 

If you order shrimp or chicken to a dish expect to pay $6.00-$8.00 extra. 

I recommend trying another restaurant in this mall!!

This place should be called the The Smallest Oyster bar...,and another Las Vegas rip-off. 

First of all out waiter, Maurice, is loud and annoying.  The minute you sit down, he is all over you like a vulture. Upon ordering he doesn't pay attention and listen, so he had to keep returning to our table. 

I ordered 12 oysters in the half shell w saltines and drawn butter. The oysters were so small I needed 2 or 3 to cover the cracker.  My friends order was completely forgotten and not submitted...his meal came when mine was just about finished. 

Pay attention to the rating. We read the poor reviews before going, but we thought it couldn't be that bad....IT WAS!

Like many places in Las Vegas, this place is overpriced. But I am on an expense account, so it does not matter today.

Service was quite good. It probably helped that we had a Italian waiter and an attractive lady in our group. Food, especially the oysters, we also above average. Overall a quite pleasant experience.

Me and my family all got steak and eggs and I made the mistake of ordering poached eggs because the  "culinary professionals" that attempted to make me said eggs couldn't do so and they offer to replace the eggs but the new eggs had some black charcoal or gristle cooked in the whites. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt, but it looked like a tiny burnt bug to me.

I ate here with a group of people on two different occasions while in Vegas and absolutely loved it both times. Kind of over priced, but the food is delicious. Great specials. I would recommend to anyone looking for a nice dinner.
I found a bug in my cup. When I tried to tell the waiter that, he acted dumb. NEVER again will we eat here. We ended up going to the restaurant across the way. There was no bugs in there food.
@planethollywoodlv @oyster bay enjoying great service , Food, and a nice lunch time crowd . Good job  !

What an amazing place!! Family owned, friendly attentive, VERY reasonably priced and the food is amazing!!! Ate here every morning of our trip and loved it!!  There were some "complainers" behind us (some people complain to just complain and are never happy! ). The staff and owners were doing everything in their power to make sure they were taken care of... we HIGHLY recommend Oyster Bay!! The steak and eggs (only 6.95) were awesome and you didn't even need steak sauce on the steak because it had so much flavor!!! 5 stars for sure!!!!

Service was good food was absolutely horrible. You could tell the fish and chips were freezer food that one could get from any grocery store. My husbands pasta dish was under the heat lamp way too long and the seafood in it was over cooked. My tomato mozzarella salad was flavorless and not fresh. Bleh wouldn't ever eat here again.

Outstanding. 

What a pleasant surprise. Best coffee I've had in years, amazingly accommodating staff (even with kids- in Vegas!) and the food was phenomenal. The pancakes here have got to be the best pancakes I've ever tried. Not sure how but they managed to join the best qualities of a pancake, a muffin and a cake into one amazing dish. Blueberry was incredible, can't wait to try another one tomorrow. The next day I went back and got
lox and a bagel, and if you have even the slightest affinity for smoked salmon, holy cow.... It was of a quality and portion that was very impressive. 

The wait staff was courteous and the place was clean. The wait was average and the food was outstanding. If that is your kind of place, go here. If not, just stay home. The restaurant world doesn't need you.

Came here with my family for breakfast since it was one of the few restaurants that were open around 8-9 AM. The food was an ultimate disappointment for how overpriced it is. $10.95 for plain french toast with 2 pieces of bacon that is burned and a tiny slice of an orange. As much as I soaked it with maple syrup, the french toast was too stale. $7.95 for a gross omelette and a tiny piece of steak that is not tender. I guess that's what you get for it being $7.95. The pancakes were just pancakes. Nothing special about this place. We waited 25 minutes for food that wasn't worth recommending. You won't see me coming back for breakfast. Our waitress was nice though! Thats probably the only pro for this place.
We're waiting the breakfast to serve for over 1 hours. Don't know what the kitchen do for cooking.

My husband loved the coconut pancakes. We were just surprised at the upcharge for turkey bacon. I would not recommend the sirloin and eggs. The coffee is served in heated cups and that is awesome. Our server, Joseph,  was wonderful.

This review is for drinks only.  A few of us decided to go to a buffet, and the others decided to spend their money on drinks.  They were initially going to order a bottle of wine, but the bartender informed them it would be much wiser of them to purchase by the glass since it was "Happy House" at the bar (All the time).  Once the rest of us arrived, a friend ordered a glass of wine and then he complained to our friends that they didn't inform him that mixed drinks were also only $5, the bartender overheard him whining and dumped his glass of wine out and told him to pick something he would actually enjoy drinking.  

The service of the bartender was excellent, he gave us a few tips on places to go / things to do and was very good.  I would definitely come back for drinks again, and sit at the bar.

Awesome steak and eggs breakfast special! A nice little spot located not far outside Elara hotel. Food was served fast and fresh. Staff was very nice even when I had forgot my purse they ran out to bring to me. It's a cute restaurant seemed to resemble quaint Italian bistro. I would definitely go back if ever in the area again. Our steak and eggs were cooked to perfection.

I wish I had read other people's review before I went there.

The service was horrible.  After ordering our drink, we put in our food order right away.  It took a while for the waiter to bring our drinks. (diet coke, ice tea and a beer)  We noticed that the restaurant isn't that big and it seem they had enough wait staff, however, it took 20 min before we finally get our drink.  
We waited 45 min and didn't see our food.  I saw a table that sat down after us already finished either food and paid.  Mind you we ordered oyster on the half shell.  Does it require any cooking???? why did it take 45 min?  

Anyways, we told the waiter to not bother with our food and we want to leave.  It was totally his fault for not putting the food order b/c he said our food will be out in 20 min.. I guess after we asked about our food, they started cooking the pasta we ordered.  The waiter was rude about it, he dropped off our drink check and just left.  There was no apology what so ever.

um... with the kind of service, I wonder if they will be in business for long.

Great steak and eggs breakfast!  All four members of my party love it!  I highly recommend going here when in Las Vegas. I did much better than here any of the Big expensive buffets !  And gluten-free chocolate dessert was wonderful!

**Sorry I'm posting so late I went May 31st**

The food is great, service is nice as well. The portions aren't that big for the prices but hey it's still good. 

I ordered the chicken Parm, it was good for the moment but I was very hungry at that point in time so I do wish they gave more. But it was 12am & they were open so they satisfied the hunger itch. 

They also make one hell of a Long Island Iced Tea!

I'd go again if necessary.

OVERPRICED FOR unauthentic Italian average food.
Go to restaurant opposite V Theatre 9.99 eat all pasta you want.

I was hungry for late lunch at 3:30pm and this was an empty restaurant i was passing by. I was fast seated, waiter was helpful in helping me decide. I had liguinni special with shrimp. Food was not exceptional  for price charged but it  arrived fast, was clean and freshly prepared.

the food was just ok.  i had the linguine clams and i thought it was a good portion of clams.  it was a little salty though but overall it was ok.  the chicken parm was also just ok.  i don't think i would go back.  it's not worth the money.
Food was just OK and service poor. Stay away. There are better places to eat in Vegas.

Total loss, the bread was like wonder bread, the pasta was good but the sauce lacked any flavor and the price for the portion was minuscule. You shouldn't go away hungry from a 23 dollar Italian entree.

Before I chose this restaurant I yelped it to see the reviews. I believe anything 3 stars and up is good, and so I decided to eat here with my wife instead of the 2 star yelped ranked restaurant directly across. The place seemed cozy like a mom and pops, and the service was awesome. The supervisor even gave my wife and I a paper copy of the recipe for the dipping sauce for the complimentary bread. We had the fried calamari, fried oyster, and the Prince Edward Mussels in the white wine variety which was amazing btw.  We could have probably done great with just the last two mentioned. The calamari portions were more than enough and in big chunks. Marinara sauce for the calamari could have been less watery though.  In the end, I'd recommend this restaurant to family and friends who want a break from shopping for a seafood bite to eat. I'd eat here again.
Stopped by craving breakfast at 1PM. Service was awesome. Very good food and the prices were reasonable considering where we were. Definitely left feeling good.

Pretty good. $5 bellinis, mimosas, & bloody marys all day. Was pretty slow... But we did come mid week, mid day. Our server was very nice & professional. I got the linguini with mussels & my husband got the fish n chips.

My friends and I were excited to eat oysters @ OBS. I asked the waiter what type of oysters we could chose from, the waiter thought maybe Louisiana or the east cost. Maybe? Shouldn't the waiter know? We didn't get to select the oysters from a list and the oyster we ate were warm. It was a dining experience. The star is for the cocktails.

OYSTER SHOTS! 

They have some great oysters here that make for a great starter!

Great place to come to if you have a group of 8 to 10, but also still great to come if it's just you and you want to suck down some oysters and have a glass of whiskey. 

They have as fresh as you can get oysters in Las Vegas. I did find it funny that their oyster monger had never been to the Ocean, but his knowledge of oysters was great, he even let me sample each one so I could choose the optimal dozen, which I appreciated because they had 4 different kinds and each one was TOTALLY different and the ones I thought I'd like were not my favorite at all...

The only thing I mark a star down is their seafood special (the lobster, crab, clams, etc.. was only ok) It might have been because that was when we had 12 people and mine was just steamed seafood, and everyone else's took longer to make so mine was sitting a little longer than I wanted. 
Still good though, yeah, still good.

Check out here and sit at the bar and get buddy buddy with the bartender/oyster monger and you'll have a great $50 meal!

I wish it could be a negative 5 stars! My food was whack they wouldn't let me change it and I still had to pay ! They don't care about their customers! The manager doesn't care ....... The employees don't care... You have to pay!

Don`t go there,waste of time and money.Food was horrible.The waiter wrote the tips on the ticket!!!!!
A shame to serve like this and the sandwich are not good at all.

Destiny, the hostess was delightful and very helpful with regards to my questions about  the food being premade or not.  Elis, our waiter, couldn't have been more friendly or professional even when I returned the salad due to the red peppers in it.  Without hesitation, he took it back and had it made over again, perfectly!  My hubby ordered Linguini and Clams and it was excellent.  I had the fish and chips which was definitely not frozen or prepackaged....the batter on the fish was super crispy and not greasy one bit!  We were pleasantly surprised to have such a great meal in this mall.

This restaurant inspired me to create a yelp account because it's just that bad. We walked over because the line was too long at Gordon Ramsey's Burgr. First sign we should've noticed was the crappy outdated menu and the fact that the place was empty. However we were starving so gave it a shot. Complimentary bread was completely stale. Calamari from the frozen foods section of Walmart. My salad looked like it was made by a third grader and had rotten lettuce. My friend's crab legs were old and gross. My "medium" salmon was extra well done, hard to swallow and came with dry mashed potatoes and overlooked broccoli. Upon leaving we saw a couple walking in and wanted to tell them to run the other way. Also wayyyyy overpriced. If that food was free at a party I wouldn't eat it again.

The evening started at Oyster Bay. We were there for my Birthday. Reviews were good, and we were expecting fresh seafood. The crab cocktail and shrimp cocktail were over steamed, old and had no flavor. The lobster tail was mushy and my mahi mahi came in a bowl with a watered down marinara sauce. It was like the worse fish stew that I wouldn't eat. The server wanted to bring something different, but he had delayed our order for so long between the appetizer and main course, that we didn't want to sit there for another 45 minutes. Long story short, I don't eat at Red Lobster, but it would have been a drastic improvement. 
Save yourself the disappointment. Don't go!

All of the entrees were excellent.  Tanner was way cool and even bought my daughter a birthday dessert. The food and Tanner deserve a 5, but the atmosphere was ok. We would have liked a little more intimate seating. Also for a meal of this caliber we would hope for fresh bread.

Sat at the bar and had the happy hour specials.  I got a glass of shiraz which was very very good   Had the sesame ahi which was excellent.  Wife had the ahi salad which was also great.  Service was fast and friendly. 

Tried the tiramisu and it was heavy and custardy.  A bit too sweet for me.
Ordered their breakfast special of steak & eggs for $5.95. I asked for over medium. Eggs were very runny. Steak was hard. But it was only for $5.95. Good customer service though.
Great food good prices  came here twice haven't been let down I will check it out again in a few months

We wanted to eat somewhere that was quick and had no wait time so we ended up here. There are no lines and they had a steak and eggs special! It was $6 for steak and eggs + purchase of a drink so = $9. It's not a bad deal for something in Vegas! The steak and eggs were amazing as well! Quick service too!

Not worth the price and time to experience as there are much better offerings. Even the store right across from it seemed to have a better value on the menu than what we were given.

Service was lackluster and just shy of failing.
If you have someone with a walking stick or walker who clearly has difficulty getting around don't take them on a round about tour of the store before sitting them at their table just a few steps from where they started. The excuse 'I can't go that way when there are customers' is not acceptable when you made no effort to explain that WE could take the shortcut and meet you at the table. Or, I don't know, seat them at a close table since they clearly have mobility issues. 

When the diners ask you questions that is the server's chance to shine and really impress. When asked "What is the soup of the day" the answer we do not expect is "You can't have that". Not only is that completely unacceptable, but it is easily misunderstood. I had to ask "Why not?" before being given the response "We ran out" and "Well, it must've been good. What was it?" to get the answer "Cream of broccoli". Which, BTW, is an obvious lie as cream of broccoli is clearly less of a hassle to make then lobster bisque or clam chowder unless you're just reheating things. The 'correct' answer and one that would've been more impressive to the question "What is the soup of the day" would have been "The soup of the day is cream of broccoli, but unfortunately we've sold out and have no more remaining". Not only does it answer the question, but makes it sound like the soup was really awesome (even if that's a lie). 

Also, when asked the question "Do you have any suggestions" you should try and push the menu or specials and give some insight. The answer "Well what do you want to order?" is not helpful and just makes it seem like you don't have time to deal with us. 

A point on the specials as well. If the restaurant is named "Oyster Bay Seafood" I expect actual seafood on the specials or properly offered. Beef Stroganoff and Chicken Pasta don't really scream 'seafood'.

Food was passable, but tainted by service and presentation.
A bread basket is provided that include some sun dried tomato focassia bread sticks and some plain bread. It is provided with the oddest combination of dipping oil I've ever seen. Typically you'd get extra virgin olive oil and balsamic vinegar or olive oil and roasted garlic to have some infused oil to dip the bread. Instead it was a confused mess of olive oil, balsamic vinegar, garlic powder, Parmesan cheese, and some generic 'Italian spice blend' that had no strong flavor to impart. When I asked the server "That looks interesting, what is in it?" I received the response "A lot of things" which just screams "I don't know and don't care because I wouldn't eat it". 

The lobster bisque was passable and had some sweet meat that tasted more like crab than lobster. Also it did not have the distinct taste of cognac that I'm used to in lobster bisque so it lacked that depth of flavor. 

The rib eye steak looked alright, but the prep cook has too much of a fascination with dried parsley. The plate was COVERED in the stuff which is a bit dated and adds nothing to the presentation or flavor. 

We were served a pasta dish and we had to remind the server, a good while later, for Parmesan cheese (which we knew they had due to being in the oil) instead of having it offered with the dish. 

The tilapia fish was pretty good and well cooked, but it reminded me a lot of some 'sweet and sour fish' you might get at Panda Express and not worth the $20 price tag. The side of wild rice was WAY too salty and just contaminated the fish as it seeped under it which brought the dish as a whole down.

All in all you may want to give this place a pass.
Avoid at all costs. Horrible service and horrible food.

This place was descent as well as the prices.  I don't recommend the lobster bisque...  The fried tilapia was great as well as the sirloin steak.  Great and friendless service.  Bellini's here are the bomb!!!
Had shrimp dish for lunch and it took so long to come out and tasted way too salty.  I would NOT recommend this.  Stay away from this restaurant.

Horrible service, waitress didn't bother to tell us she was leaving and introduce us to new waiter. New waiter didn't bother to introduce himself to us either ... appetizers didn't come out which I just decided to cancel since our meals had already arrived. At no time did they ask to refill our waters or ask if we wanted anything else to drink from the bar.

Pleasant surprise among Miracle Mile restaurants! Great bar deal: dinner was $10.99 and included a large salad, bread and a generous portion for entree. House wine was $4 and the bartender poured generously. 
Nice ambiance. You forget you're in a mall.

Not worth the high price for low quality food. I never had my glass refilled or checked on the whole time my wife and I were dining. Their shrimp linguine special is plain and disgusting. My coke was flat. The waitress even gave my wife the wrong drink, when she specifically asked for a Mimosa. If you want good food and good service, don't waste your time here. No wonder why it was pretty much empty.

Great location for a good restaurant, which Oyster Bay isn't. The seafood was cooked okay but the sauce on the pasta the shrimp was in was SOOO salty! I could barley keep it down after I left. The other people with me got some meals that were also really salty and overcooked salmon. Aside from that, the service was pretty horrible. Will not be returning.

Had breakfast here one morning and was not disappointed. Breakfast specials are offered for reasonable prices. The portions were just right. Service was excellent and fast. I passed by the restaurant every day of my stay and now wish I had stopped more often. I only had breakfast so not sure how other meals were but it was always crowded.

Since I was staying at the Planet Hollywood for a couple of nights, my party decided to just eat whatever was close to us. We found Oyster Bay Seafood and we all love oysters, so we were pretty excited. 

We came here for oysters but we saw the steak and egg special for around $7 and thought that was a deal that we couldn't pass up. The steak was okay, a little over cooked but I won't really complain because it was less than $10 and they had eggs. We went ahead and ordered some oysters too, which everyone enjoyed.

Had the fish and chips for lunch. In all honesty it was just ok, not great. I was hoping for a traditional beer battered filet but they serve it up crunchy seasoned bread style. Don't get me wrong it was tasty but it didn't hit the spot. One of my fish filets was seriously overcooked and was tough and rubbery so i didn't eat it just the yummy bread coating. The fish is served with slightly seasoned chips, aka fries that were yummy, but you really can't mess up on fries.  The staff was really friendly and service was awesome. Danny my waiter was great! I do think it was a little overpriced as well for the amount of food you get. Oyster Bay is a hit or miss.

Honestly, I can't believe that this place is still open with all the changes Planet Hollywood has gone through. The service is consistent and friendly but no enthusiasm. The menu is dated and even on the strip seemed expensive for a plate of pasta. 

I had an appetizer which was something in italian that I could not pronounce so therefore I felt stupid ordering it but besides a salad it seemed to be the most relatively healthy dish. It was an eggplant with ricotta and a marinara sauce. Well the eggplant was sliced SUPER thin, I mean there was barely any there, it was battered and fried and rolled around ricotta, with marinara sauce served on top. The flavor was decent but you should have to try to mess that combination up. However, I spent $15 on ricotta cheese. Blah! The BF had Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo, it was bland and not a good alfredo sauce. I'm not rushing to get back to this place. 

I wouldn't not have picked this place but the out of town friends were flying by the seat of their pants. Man those non planners!
Try another restaurant. The salmon roulade was frozen and not very good. Accompanied by a potato side dish, also frozen. I ordered a salad as an appetizer. It was horrible.

We absolutely loved the the Oyster Bay!!... We had dinner there after a show and it was great. My kids loved it and so did my husband and I.  The food was really good and the service was great!!! We will def be going back the next time we go to Vegas again.

Eh.  I don't know.

Food was okay... drinks were super duper strong, to the point of almost nastiness.  

I don't think I would try to come back here.

Here's some advice...don't go.  Service was mediocre, order was wrong, food was bland.  Still kicking myself for eating there last night.  With all of the good places to eat in Vegas, avoid this spot.

Had no intention of eating here but the places around were all closing for the night so we decided to give it a shot. The calamari was so fresh and tender. Probably the best I've had since right on the Mediterranean in Greece. The salmon was also cooked and seasoned very well. Service was quick and fast...it was the end of the night and pretty empty though. I'd come back here again!

Pretty average food for a way overpriced menu. I had a scallop dish and my friend had stuffed shrimp. There are no restrooms at the restaurant and you have to walk quite a ways to use the restroom in the mall. They bring you bread and bread sticks at the beginning of the meal with olive oil and balsamic vinaigrette.  I had a great soft bread stick but my friend bit into his and it was as hard as a rock literally!!

Jen S. and I stopped here for breakfast.  Conveniently located inside the Miracle Mile Mall.  Due to the time zone difference, it was an early up and we were hungry.
We stopped in and were quickly seated in the outside area.  The outside is under the dome of the Mall, but it had an outside area feel.
An order of pancakes and eggs with bacon later.  Excluding the toast incident, it was a nice breakfast stop.  I would recommend it for people over there that wants to grab some fuel for a day in the casinos or pools.
I wanted something small and light to hold me over until dinner. I decided to come here and order shrimp cocktail. I got 4 shrimps. F-O-U-R. Four for $14! I was very disappointed.

Meh. Not good, not horrible, does the job for breakfast.  

Ordered eggs benedict, and wasn't that best.  Eggs were overcooked so you didn't see the yolk oozing over the English muffin (it was dry yolk).  I wanted to complain, but I was tired and hungry after a long night out in Vegas.

Felt like it was an amateur cook making the eggs benedict.  The key is so that the yolk melts over the English muffin.  If I was in Vegas and stayed at Planet Hollywood/Hilton again, probably wouldn't go to this place again.

Staff is extremely rude and uncaring.Manager has attitude of a 3 year old.  We waited 15 minutes for table, when seated we waited about 10 minutes, finally here comes the manager to take our drink order.  Waitress shows up and waits on table next to us who was seated after we were.  I rose to leave and informed she had just dumped a nice possible tip.  She didn't care, manager looks at us as we were leaving i explained why and he sneers.  They can take the union wages and live on them as I wouldn't eat here if paid to.

This has been one of the worst Vegas dining experiences.   The restaurant was not crowded but the meal took nearly an hour to come out.   Meanwhile, our waiter took 20 minutes just to bring us bread.   I should also mention that we ordered breakfast.   Omelets do not take an hour to make.   The cheese tasted like it was past its prime on the omelet.   The steak I ordered medium was super well done.   Overall, I'd recommend going somewhere else.   Very bad experience.

Just don't understand the negative reviews. We stumbled upon this place while looking for food after a long day of work. What a hidden gem. The fresh oysters were great. A choice between fanny bay and west point. What a great choice to make so we had 6 of each. Both were delicious but the points went to fanny bay. The other selections were just as good and we decided upon sharing the linguine with the seafood selection. Just mouth watering! An excellent choice and will remember this next time in town.

If I could give this place a negative star rating I would.  This is by far the worst restaurant I have ever attended.  First off, the wait was terrible.  We waited an hour before our entrees came out.  Just like the previous reviewer mentioned, we counted the number of times the thunder storm came on, about 5 times.  The waiter never came around to apologize nor explain the long wait.  Our water was never refilled.  Although I finally encountered the manager to report the problem, he came back 10 minutes later with no explanation and a weak apology.  The food was served at that moment.  That was the next disaster.  The chicken of my friend's chicken pasta came out overcooked and black.  I ordered a 6 oz. filet mignon and eggs and replaced the potatoes with fruit...misadvertised since the supposed filet mignon was just regular flank.  I got potatoes instead of fruit.  When I told the waiter that I had  ordered fruit, he did not apologize and in fact when he went to the kitchen I could see him glaring at me from across the restaurant....talk about creepy.  To top off the 2+ hour lunch, we received a bill with an unaccounted 3rd extra drink, nonadvertised drink refill charges, and a 18% gratuity (also not advertised).  When we told the waiter that he charged us an extra drink and that we were not informed about the extra refill charges he scoffed and told us that he would correct the mistakes.  No apologies again.  Of course, he didn't get the 18%...he's lucky he even got a dollar.  They're lucky we even stayed just to pay for their crappy food and service.
They have great banana french toast in this place. Too good to die for. Every time we come to Vegas we all ways stop foe our breakfast.

My review is only for the breakfast special of steak and eggs for $5.95.  My daughter and I were walking around the Miracle Mile shops and we see this electric sign in front of Oyster Bay Seafood for that says Steak and Eggs for $5.95.  You can't beat $12 for breakfast (the breakfast included steak, eggs, potatoes and toast) and you must order a drink.  So my daughter and I decided to give this a try.  We were able to get seated in their "outdoor" area, the waiter was very nice and after we placed our order, in about 5 minutes our food came out.  The steak was really thin and it tasted great with A1 Steak Sauce.

It was satisfying and we walked out of there with money left in my wallet, happy and full.

We were torn between Oyster Bay and Ocean One across from them. The deciding factor was the ladies at Ocean One were rude about me carrying in a drink. Velisa welcomed us and there was no wait. 

Josue was our waiter and was efficient and fun. We started with Calamari and Lobster Bisque. The calamari was average but when drinking, food is food;) The bisque was rich and amazing. We also had the ribeye with mashed potatoes. It was really good as well. See you next time!

We ate here for dinner on a Tuesday night. First, service was a bit slow. We waited 10 minutes after our drinks came for the server to come back for our order. I think he forgot us. The lobster bisque was ok -- I've had better. My husband and kids ordered the shrimp and crab ravioli, fettuccine Alfredo, and seared sea scallops, which were all good. I ordered the bacon wrapped filet. It was not good. I asked for medium-rare, but my steak came out very well done and tasted like it had been microwaved. The server was very apologetic and rushed to get me a new steak prepared properly. It was medium-rare, but unfortunately just tasted strange and I barely ate any of it. Moral of the story is not to get steak at a seafood restaurant I guess.

Ooh.  Um... THE SUCK...

The few of us who somehow woke before noon walked about the Miracle Mile shops in search of some breakfast eats.  Unfortunately, we stumbled upon this joint and had too little mental acuity to give it a once over before deciding...

The decor and theme would be perfect if it were an outdoor restaurant, not so much under a faux sky in a darkened corner of a mall.

Service was responsive, though that probably had a lot to do with us being only the second party in the establishment.  Our server did comp me a grapefruit juice when it turned out that they weren't out...

But the menu.  Ech.  Not a one (of the four of us) were happy with our meals.  Yes, its primarily a seafood and wine bar, but REALLY?  How do you screw up AND be chintzy on breakfasts and salads?  I dare say, I've had better for cheaper at Denny's...
Very good oysters on  half shell,  clams on linguini with red saice. Good service from Andrew, reasonably priced. Had breakfast there next morning.

This place isn't the same.. Used to be one of my favorite places to go to when I come to Vegas. Not sure if the management has changed, but the service level and food is sub-par. I will not be coming back..
For a seafood place in "Vegas" it is not bad.  Prices are reasonable and service is good.  Good happy hour well drinks.

Had filet mignon and oysters here, and it wasn't that bad. Was a little scared when we walked into the place, sat down, ordered, and _then_ I yelped the place on the Treo.

Filet mignon was cooked well, although they got my order wrong and I had actually ordered the filet mignon with chicken.

Maybe we got them on a good day?

This restaurant is alright. A little pricey.

They servce breakfast all day, which is awesome! 

We tried the lobster bisque, it was really good!!! Really creamy, sweet and savory. The calamari casserole was okay. It tasted cold, the squid was chewy, the spaghetti seemed like it was not cooked right. The mariniara wasn't think or hearty, but really runny. 

The blood mary was $11.00, totally not worth it. I've had better bloody mary drinks in OC 

I would try it again for the breakfast next time.

Came here for lunch with my friends by default - we were shopping around Miracle Mile and all 6 of us were indecisive on where to eat and decided after walking 2 rounds of the mall to just eat here because everyone was starving.  Unfortunately I didn't order any oysters or seafood - my review is merely based on their lunch specials as we all ordered off of that menu.  I had an angel hair pasta - I forget what it was called just as unmemorable the dish was.  I literally had to add 3-4 heaping spoonfuls of chili flakes to make this dish have flavor.  It was plain pasta and sauce for $12 and a small portion.  I would justify the price if it was filling and flavorful, but in this case it wasn't.  My other friends commented that their meals were just ok.  If you are in Vegas, there are a plethora of good restaurants.  Just avoid this as I will do my next trip.

I came here thinking it would be just another diner but I was pleasantly surprised. It feels like one but I thought the service was great and the food was decent.

They had a special $5.95 for steak and eggs. This was a great deal because they give you a decent amount of food and it was not bad.

I opted for the chocolate chip pancakes. They were huge and fluffy. I liked them and it was good value too. I got the bacon and they were incredibly crispy maybe a tad too burnt.

They offered to take our pictures and sell it to us in a nice paper frame for $20 or something like that. I thought it was a little hokey and felt like Disney but we liked the picture so we got one.

I'm saddened that as I write this review that this place only has 2.5 stars. Really? I've always enjoyed visiting this place. I first came here years ago, before the days where I Yelped every eating establishment. Sometimes you just trust what you see and experience.

Located in the Miracle Mile shops and Planet Hollywood Casino, my girlfriend and I were looking for a place on Friday for lunch in the area, and after some disappointing displays at some of the other restaurants, came here.

There's something to be said about ambiance, and Oyster Bay certainly creates a very intimate setting. While the restaurant is actually indoors, there's a look and feel of a outdoor patio right on a boardwalk, from the decor of wooden posts lined with roped netting, and as diners people-watch passersby walking along the wooden flooring. Not far off is the rainstorm fountain, so the occasional thunder rolling and pouring rain can be heard in the distance, which makes you imagine you're in the southern wetlands.

Our meal came out as such:
Complimentary bread came with a saucer of oil, grated cheese, and vinegar. My refillable soda cost $2.95. A cup of soup (Lobster Bisque) was $4.95. A large bowl of the Clams Posillipo (topped with three slices of grilled garlic bread) was $12.95. The Capellini Pomodoro (which we substituted the angel hair pasta with fettuccine) came out $10.95.

The seafood is good overall: lobster bisque and anything with clams (like the Clams Posillipo). Portion sizes are plentiful. Our waitress Monica, and overall service, was attentive and fast; the refills kept coming, the food arrived in a timely manner. I will say that the sauces on some dishes can come out to be a bit potent (the clams a little salty, the pasta a little sour), but flavorful in the right portions.

No restrooms, so you'll have to find one in the mall facilities.

Ignore the general consensus. This is one of the regular spots I look forward to when heading to Vegas.
I would give it a "good, not great" rating. We had the crab pasta and it wasn't great. It's absolutely over-priced. Probably won't order from this restaurant again.

Popped in for breakfast based on great Yelp reviews and their offering of Steak and Eggs.  Come on, it's eggs........with steak!  For breakfast!  One of my favorites. Always!  
My husband had the French toast and it was so delicious I wanted to be jealous that I hadn't ordered that instead but I couldn't because my steak and eggs kept bringing me back to my plate. Top it off with a cold Mimosa and a big mug of coffee and I left super satisfied. 
I must also brag about our server, Andrew Laffin. He was super nice, attentive and happy. Always there with a quick refill or just to check in with us. I appreciate his friendliness. A little happy goes a long way especially after a long night.

I have been coming to Oyster Bay since 2004. It has had a few different managers/owners in that time but they have been able to keep the quality that I have come to expect. 

I have tried almost everything in the menu and cannot remember having a bad plate. Oysters are always fresh, steak well flavored and tender, fish moist and cooked perfectly. Hands down my go to place when I'm in Vegas. I always make it a point to eat here. 

My favorite dish has been the Linguine Mediterranean. Yummy. All the fresh flavor pasta cook perfectly a little spice but not too much. Great dish.

Breakfast here is A-OK and props to them for still serving eggies at 2pm (the prefect time for a Vegas breakfast ). It' a simple place. Small oyster bar inside and a dozen or so tables for dining 'al fresco' (there's no way you're forgetting you're still inside). The breakfast menu was simple enough - omelet's, a bagel sammie, pancakes - nothing out of the ordinary. My omelet (the Vegas) was filled with a few veggies, some avocado, cheddar and bacon. All super at soaking up the booze from the prior evening. The mimosas are $5, if you need to crush that hangover, and are standard sized but tasty. Overall, a solid breakfast in a creepy PH mall area. Standard Vegas morning. 

Pro tip: Planning on drinking mass quantities? The bar/restaurant directly across from it seems to have an all day happy hour going on.
Besides reasonable prices and a nice waiter, I see no reason I would ever go back with all of the other great options for food in LV. Skip it.

The first time I splashed down here was on my first visit to Vegas.  One of my gal pals had suggested going to Vegas shopping.  I was incredulous, "What are we going to shop for,"  I replied, "Bumper stickers?"  "No, really," she promised me, they have tons of stores.
Days later, in the midst of a purse and shoe shopping frenzy at what was then the Aladdin, we fell into seats under the tiki hut type awning of the Oyster Bay restaurant.  It felt like home.  Between being a Chesapeake Bay type seafood house, and being run by the New York Scotto family, they were hitting on all my childhood food memories.
Order the SEAFOOD people!  They feature the simple, unassuming perfectly cooked type of seafood dishes found in Maryland seafood houses.  White table clothes, traditional choices like fried shrimp, shrimp with linguine, or the lobster bisque, served by somewhat brusque, yet efficient and professional waiters, makes Oyster Bay a classic.  The waiters warm right up if you chat with them.
Last night I had delicious Shrimp Frances with a mild batter, and scalloped potatoes that were as rich as dream.
Good, stiff drinks from a full bar, also make the people watching priceless.  The Sex on a Balcony reminds me of New Orleans.
The unexpected addition of a typical late afternoon type Chesapeake Bay thunderstorm, adds to the authentic atmosphere. They are open long hours, and this is now always my first stop in Vegas.
Seafood is excellent- we have eaten dinner here 3 times- the Ciopiono is very good- The Diablo delicious and Chicken Parm is good as well - all large enough to share

The service: My party and I had just got done staying, getting ripped off, and getting down right bad service all up and down the stip. Tropicana? Down right awful all around. The Cosmo? Ok, but $5 for a WARM 6 oz bottled water that I'm not allowed to keep the lid to and have to on? Come on! By the time I got to this restaurant, I had already had my fair share of bartenders and servers sigh at my simple, NON-modified orders. I defiantly wasn't expecting good service, in fact I had given up in it long before I got there, but surprise surprise, we had great service here! Our server Mimi (I think that was her name? Of not, somebody correct me because credit is due) was a breath of fresh air. We were treated great and as far as I could tell there was no alternative motive. We chose this location because is one of the only restaurants in that area that was still serving breakfast after 1. We had a couple $4-$5 bloody Mary's and mimosas and a couple $6-$8 steak and eggs, which is "woohoo! As good as it gets! " in Vegas when it comes to pricing. We also had a few oyster shooters that were pretty bomb. I highly recommend the one they make with the tomato flavored vodka. Yummmmm.... I will have to agree with one of the past reviewers though, with a name like Oyster Bay, they should have more than 2 types of oysters. Either way though, I will remember to come back next time I'm in Vegas. :)

For as mediocre as the food is, this place is insanely overpriced!!! It took forever for our waiter to come get our orders and the place was pretty much empty. The bread seemed stale to me and it again, took forever for them to bring it out.
My fettuccine Alfredo tasted like something that came out of a box and it was 22 bucks?! Yuck!
With all the other wonderful options Vegas has to offer, steer clear of this place!

The food was good but the service was horrible. We stopped for breakfast and got the special, two eggs with hash browns and toast. Our waited disappeared after delivering our food and we didn't see him again until we had to flag him down for our check. The automatic bill pay system included a mandatory tip ... which was annoying and not clearly disclosed before we ordered.
Sunday Deal steak and eggs for $4.99, perfect portion, not massive, tasty steak, great and fast service.

Was a 2 minute walk through the mall from my hotel and had breakfast specials. Was very good (kind of hard to mess up eggs) but the service and the people there were awesome. I had steak and eggs and the sirloin was cooked to perfection (I like my meat still moving, no sense to eat dried  out meat ) definitely recommend going here while I'm vegas for breakfast

Spectacular food, spectacular service! Overall, just a spectacular experience! 
We were looking for somewhere to eat in Vegas on the strip that wasn't too expensive. This is right inside Planet Hollywood next to the pond that has the rain show. We were seated quickly and the service was very pleasant. We got the Greek Salad, Chicken Parmesan, and Meatball Sub. It was delicious.

Just ate lunch here, had the alfredo, DO NOT ORDER THIS DISH!!!! it was horrible, the sauce tasted like it was from frozen, soooo much oil and butter (if that was even real butter) that the sauce looked 'broken'. they give you a bread plate but don't bring you any bread unless you ask for it, i needed some so absorb all that fatty grease. had a coupon for free dessert, ordered the crem√® brul√®e, thanks for the big bowl of pudding. i'd rather eat the food off of the cheapest buffet than to ever come back here! 

Not that it was our waiters fault but the service was super slow, felt like they only had one "cook" back there. 

I heard breakfast was good but ill never experience it because i never want to come here again!

We chose to sit at the bar for faster service. The bartender Steve was extremely nice. The food was served hot and fresh. 

The bar served all menu items and about ten options that were bar only. Hubby had pasta with a spicy sauce and I ordered crab cakes. The crab cakes were smaller than I expected but with a side of fries it was just right.

Our total bill with one drink and tip was $31.

Good food, good service and good company!

Our server (forgot his name :() was great! He was extremely nice, very attentive and threw out a few compliments to me and my girls :)

The bread and olive oil was good but the main courses were great! We all had something different. I got the 1/2 King Crab legs which came with mash potatoes, my best friend got the Mediterranean pasta (thats not the real name but it does have Mediterranean in the title lol.) and our other friend got the chicken alfredo. 

Each person was satisfied with their meal. We would definitely go back next time in Vegas.

Not a good value and a very mediocre experience. The food quality isn't great and the service not much better. We waited so long that I thought they forgot about us. Not once, but twice. Bread baskets seemed to be going to other tables but not ours. Food was getting served but not ours. Food quantity was varied. Some dishes were mounded pasta but mine not so much. Sandy clams in a thin soupy broth that was reminiscent of Campbell's tomato soup. The tilapia was mushy. Cheesecake was "meh". Not recommended!

Edit, the next day experience: I hope the Scotto family doesn't have me "swimming with the fishes" for this but my wife and I woke up with the same thought on our mind... This goes down in history as one of the worst dining experiences we've had. So bad that both of us, unbeknownst to the other, was doing the same thing - completely avoiding eye contact with the inept waiter. That's exactly what the manager did to us so I supose its tit for tat. But I almost regret leaving a tip. It's hard not to since the waiter stands over you as the bill is settled on a tablet computer.   

I could go on and on about the experience but will refrain from doing so. The memory isn't pleasant.

I work at the miracle mile shops, and every now and again I like to come in early and treat myself to breakfast. I choose to eat at oyster bay,  because they were offering a breakfast special. Well when I sat down and ordered my breakfast, the server asked if I wanted coffee,  orange juice or milk . I said water please. He said I had to be charged for a beverage. He said it was policy. I then had to inform him that I had an ulcer and I wasn't able to drink anything caffeinated, or acidic, etc... he asked management, but they insisted that I order a beverage in addition to my water.

My friends and I were craving oysters so we looked this place up. The service was quick and friendly. 

The oysters how ever....

Fresh oysters were a bit small, they were good but at first somewhat did look too promising. It could have looked better. 

The oysters Rockefeller were okay but to much spinach on top and the oysters for those were a bit on the small side. 

The place it self was nice seats inside and outside (well inside the mall of course). 

I would go back there for a quick bite and maybe to try some other items.
The price has increased by a dollar now to $6.95 for the steak and eggs special.  They also added the Country Fried Steak to the special.  Good is still pretty good for the price and quickness.

The food here is pretty outright disgusting.  I had the lobster bisque (or should I say cream bisque?), which was so salty that I thought I was preserving my tongue, as well as the chicken parm.  I don't even wanna comment on the chicken parmigiana because it was that nasty but for yelp, I will.  Chewy, sour....inedible.  Luckily we came here on a Sunday morning and they had a 15% off promotion going on.....lucky us aye?

Service was also on the slow side.  Although she was definitely nice, I dont see how it could take a person 25 minutes to grab us the check.  I don't give one star reviews very often but this place gets the mark.  

Oh, they also give free picture postcards with your meal.  A kind female took our pictures in the beginning of the meal and told us she'd return with our free picture.  She never did.  So much for that aye?

This was our first time here and we were not disappointed. Wow. My wife and I shared a dozen oysters and clams posillipo and she had a ceaser salad with grilled chicken and I had the bruschetta. My oh my. Everything tasted fresh and was delicious. We will definitely be back again and come back the next time we are in town. Oh, and can't forget a shout out to our server Andy, he was on his game and service was great.

During a recent stay in Vegas I ate dinner at Oyster Bay three times! After eating at places with exorbitant prices for mediocre food, I found Oyster Bay to be appropriately priced for consistently fresh and delicious seafood & pasta. 

Between the four of us (kids included!) we had the Rigatoni Bolognese (amazing), linguini with clam sauce (al dente and perfect with fresh herbs), Oysters (Fanny Bay and Blue Point), Linguini with Meatballs (kids menu!), Prime Rib (Mother's Day Special), Garden Salad, Shrimp and Crab Cocktail, and my favorite- Linguini Mediterranean (clams, prawns, mussels & calamari in a mild or spicy red sauce). I chose to have the linguini spicy and I seriously could eat that every day. It reminded me so much of my time in Italy. 

Oyster Bay Seafood and Wine Bar is located in the Miracle Mile Shops attached to Planet Hollywood. The owner is originally from Naples, Italy and has been in the restaurant business for over 40 years. If you are looking for excellent Italian food or seafood, this is the place to go. You can choose a place with 2000 reviews, wait in line for an hour and pay $10 for a single taco, or trust me and enjoy a satisfying meal that will leave you content and satiated.

A small quaint restaurant, located inside the Miracle Mile Mall, not far from the Elara.  It was a quiet Wed evening, only one other table of diners.  More peeps later.  I ate here a few months ago and I'd say that experience was average and so was the food.  I had Coippino and would've rated everything a 3.0.  I have to admit I came here this time out of convenience and it because it was somewhere familiar.  

I ordered the Maine Lobster Fra Diavolo. I was disappointed to hear they did not have any Maine Lobster at a seafood restaurant for a regular menu item. My server, Angel S was very accommodating, he suggested substituting the half of lobster for a lobster tail and was ok with me.  I was pleasantly surprised when my entr√©e arrived.  The lobster tail was big!  It was cooked to perfection and the dish had an abundance of mixed seafood. Yum!  Diavolo is usually mildly spicy however the sauce was not spicy at all.  Personally I like garlic and chili and it definitely lacked both.  They offer $5 Peach Bellini, Mimosa, or Bloody Mary all day (weekday?) I had the Bellini, it was refreshing but found the peach syrup sitting at the bottom of the glass too sweet.

The service was 4.75 and the entr√©e and cocktail 4.5

had breakfast here since it was attached to the mall and i was staying in planet hollywood. open early and my flight was at 12 so i had to grab lunch real fast. ate at the bar our server was from texas so that was lovely, we reminisced about what we miss from home. whataburger was the answer haha. i had eggs Benedict my friend had dozen oysters and steak and eggs.

my food was great and cooked perfectly. hollandaise was on point. the 2nd egg i ate was over cooked but it was okay still good not over done. my friends steak and eggs were bland and over cooked. the oysters i think he liked them they only had 2 types of oysters a sweat and a salty kind he had 6 of each. the chef didnt know too much about oysters so we couldnt be educated on this. but thats okay still a good breakfast. all in all i had a great meal here and def would eat here again should i stay nearby but not some place id go out of the way for.

We had an outstanding dinner.
My wife had the pasta bolognese and I had the special lobster bowl dinner - both excellent choices 
We highly recommend this restaurant located in the shopping mall adjacent to Planet Hollywood
And ask Luis Gonzalez about the fish in the large aquarium over the bar.
Server hustled an extra tip.  It was electronic transaction said to input a percentage for the tip. Turned out to be twenty dollars on a 20 dollar order. Beware

Disappointment.  My family and I were looking to get some seafood just to end the foodie adventure so we decided to give this place a try.  1 dozen oysters small and looked undernourished.  Upside it was fresh, no funky smell and we didnt get sick.  The other item we got was the shrimp cocktails.  3 orders at 14.95 a plate you would figure it would be something semi great.  Nope, the plating of the shrimp cocktails looked as if it was just tossed on the plate.  The shrimp was not deveined properly or at all, and if it didn't come with cocktail sauce there would have been no flavor.  Waiters were kind 
to you when they were at your table but they didnt come to your table frequently enough in order to see if you needed anything. (Drink refills, bill,)  It seemed a little chaotic.  I don't think I would try it again.  The atmosphere of the place warrants $$$ but the food quality and prep I believe it should be at $$ prices.  14.95 for that kind of shrimp is funny.  I've had bigger and better at a mexican restaurant in East Los Angeles for 8.00
Great place for your buck in Vegas! The food is good too! We stopped by because they had a great deal that we couldn't resist! If you're ever near this place I'd give it a go!

Oysters was not fresh, had a fishy taste. Food was very salty. Clam linguini red sauce looked and tasted like it came out of a can with runny sauce. Scallops had "lobster bread crumbs" toppings, but couldn't taste the lobster and tasted like biting into a chunk of salt. Waitress said I ordered all of their best dishes...i'm a little confused as to why they all tasted so bad if they're the best???!! #headscratch

Came here for lunch hoping for some decent food and a place to watch the World Cup matches since they had TV's. The hostess seated us at the bar which was fine but I'm not sure if they forgot about people still wanting to order food at the bar as it took us nearly an hour to get our food!

Luckily the bartender tried to salvage the situation and offered our group free drinks but it went downhill afterwards with sub-par food for the price. We all tried something different and portions were small and the food was far too simple for what we were expecting (but at that point we were starving and would've eaten anything). I guess we should've known better to go to a restaurant inside a mall!

Overpriced and disappointing.

What died on our calamari plate? Not squid. The plate was filled with voids of empty space, not anything worth the price they charge for a plate of fried calamari.

Our chicken Parmesan sandwich was passable to say the least but nothing extraordinary or notable. Even the ingredients used for the complimentary bread could have been better utilized in the French Revolution. 

There are so many options in Vegas do not waste your time or money here.  You can find food and a good time in this city if you play your cards right and this institution is simply an Ace High in a land of Royal Flushes.

Ehh...not a big fan of this place. The food was decent. There seemed to be a little tension between our server and the hostess. It was awkward. I had the lobster bisque and it was good but not good good. Everyone else seemed to enjoyed their food. Our server checked on us quite a bit and my aunty decided to leave her a nice little tip. 

Probably wouldn't come back though. There's other restaurant in the shop area we would like to give a try.

We had the Poulet Mignon (Menu Price $ 39.95) and Jumbo Shrimp Francese (Menu Price $ 31.95) on Thursday evening (Frb 23rd). The food was Ok because the Poulet Mignon's 6 OZ prime cut beef ordinary and the marsala filled poultry was just plain greasy. I mean it was average. Something that you can have at an Applebees for example. Wife's Jumbo Shrimp was average at best. It was just an egg battered baked shrimp, more like a saut√©ed shrimp omelette. Should just ordered one course and an appetizer. The problem is the price. Is it a disguised highway robbery or are they asking us to pay a portion for the view and rent?

This place is the worst. 

I won't wind you with all the terrible terrible points, from terrible service, poor quality, etc


I spent 18.99 for 5 pieces of medium shrimp.....wtf. I don't mind dropping money for a good meal...

But 5 shrimp.

I told the waiter, and he literally was like "yeah." 

just terrible, do not come and support this mess of a overpriced business...they must be making some crazy ass profit margins on these plates that have no food...or quality...or presentation

Wanted a quick and decent lunch in the miracle mile. My friend and I arrived around 11 am where they were serving both lunch and breakfast. I chose to get a seafood diavalo for $22 and my friend got steak and eggs for $11. While the pasta sounded good, I regretted ordering it because it was a small dish and didn't have near the flavor I had hoped. The service was good and the atmosphere was also good.
Decent food, great service.  HUGE margaritas, and not stingy with the booze.  We got the lobster tail and crab legs.  The lobster was sweet, if a bit dry.  Crab was very good quality.

This review is for the Oyster Bay seafood and wine bar Restaurant located in the Miracle mile inside Planet Hollywood.  We came here August 16, 2016 for dinner.

The seafood is no good and neither is the service.

This restaurant is quaint with an old fashion nautical theme and in a good corner location infront of the hourly indoor rain storm.  But, that's about it...

The fried  calamari was blah.

We let the waiter know that our lobster bisque was cold & the lobster chunks weren't thawed all the way & just tasted wrong. The waiter apologized and offered to warm it up & we declined because we knew it wouldn't change the flavor plus he was probably going to pop it in the microwave.  Of course, we didn't eat the lobster bisque and the waiter charged us for it anyway.  Yes, we still paid for it!

The alaskan King crab legs were a joke.  They were skinny, dry & flavorless.

The twin lobster tails were also dry & flavorless.

The kid's grilled cheese & fries were ok.

The beer wasn't that cold and the lobster bisque was colder!

Thumbs down for this restaurant and I wouldn't recommend it.
Great food, great service, great desert:)). Claudio was very good server, made good suggestions. Very happy!!!

Stopped in for lunch while waiting to check in to our hotel. We started with a caesar salad and got the burger special and grilled salmon for our entrees. Service was a little slow but the food was pretty good. Prices are on point for lunch.

A bit late for Breakfast buffet...and a little too early for BIG buffet.  The crew decides to eat a simple breakfast before we start day 2 of LV 2011.  

It's a small restaurant in the middle of the Miracle Mile Shops and the decor made it look like a spot on the pier/port.  Hmm....sure did took them a while to bring our water and menus :(

The restaurant only had our table to serve, yet...they were a bit slower than I expected.  By the time I ordered their California Omelet to the time our dishes came....a good 20-25 minutes.  Bummmmm ER!

A few of my buddies ordered coffee and it was...not as dark as it suppose to be.  They brought that to the attention of our waitress and her response was..."oh, those are Italian coffee...it's suppose to be that color"

Hhaha...their facial expression after that comment was priceless.

Granted, they did make a new batch of coffee just for our table and the food tasted decent.  But the service sucked so bad with the fact that they are competing with 100s of restaurants in Las Vegas....they go to step up their game!!! I'm definitely not coming back here with so many choices to pick here :(

We came here after a show since it was really close. The wait staff was friendly and efficient. We ordered some raw oysters on the half shell that were very tasty. The fried oysters were also tasty. They were fresh, so not fishy,but still rich. Yum! Not cheap, but at least good. 

The lobster bisque got mixed reviews from our table. I thought mine was okay, but the rest of our group thought it was quite salty and inedible. So, either my taste buds were having an off night, or I was so happy with the oysters that I was still on a seafood high. Not sure, but we did send back one of the bowls and they took it off the tab.  The rest of the food was not too memorable. 

I'd eat there again for the oysters, but not sure about the other stuff. 

If you like oysters, give this place a try.

The quality of the food is the WORST-OF-THE-WORST! The $7.95 steak is crappy tasting, even with A1 Steak Sauce covering the horrible meat. I've had $7.95 steak before that was much better. They couldn't even get a grilled cheese sandwich right. My 4 year old nephew loves grilled cheese sandwiches and he only took 1 bite. THE FOOD IS WHACK!!!!!!

Stopped in for lunch and was not impressed. Water and drinks weren't brought out until after the food and the portions were tiny. Warning: the shrimp cocktail is four pieces for $12.95. We had several wait staff reach over and across the table to pick up breakfast tableware while we were eating and the service just.. Awkward.
Came here and tried my first oysters and they were good. Great customer service and a lot of different sea food for all you seafood lovers.

Had breakfast here in April 2017. Gotta say that it was the best breakfast that I have had in 20 years. Omelet was perfect, toast was toasted well, hash browns were smaller bites and fully cooked (not large and mushy like most places) bacon was cooked correctly (well done) coffee was tasty and plentiful. Ambiance was decent and the service was excellent. I will be back.

Celebrating my son's 30th birthday Lunch here and my Salmon was cooked perfectly, the sauce on the Rigatoni was delicious my Son had the Shrimp Scampi that also was superb. It took a little while to get some water and our order in but well worth the wait. I asked the waiter do they do anything here for birthdays he said no... ok no problem..I'll figure out something later.
Well going through the "shop find save booklet". This restaurant will give you two free desserts, so I  went back to see if they would honor the coupon, after all we are celebrating a birthday we just had lunch less than an hour ago.....Well this is were it all went bad, even though our lunch was 5 stars...the manager said she would not honor it, she would have to reRing it and to come back tomorrow... I don't think so..  Sadly I won't be back just because of that.. many other places I can go celebrate.

I really like this place, the food is excellent the decor nice, and I usually meet someone new to eat with.  Not this time!  I was very disappointed.  The selection of oysters was severly lacking.Tthere were only two choices, and I can get those at the local supermarket.  The Happy Hour bar specials are all gone, and the service just so so.  Apparently they have a new manager.  

Let's hope for the best.  Otherwise I'll be hanging out at King's in The District.

This is a prime example of a horrible restaurant, with horrible food,  and minimal service that is just taking advantage of being on the strip and overcharging everything except their wine. The bread was not good it seemed steal to me and store bought,  I didn't even finish my oysters on the half shell, which I would normally view as a crime, I could tell they used alot of breading in my stuffed shrimp... Instead of crab meat,  my entrees presentation reminded me of a school cafeteria lunch which is also how the potatoes and broccoli tasted with absolutely no seasoning at all. I normally don't write reviews but I am pretty upset that I just spent $60 on a piece of crap meal was pretty bad service.
